snippet: Villagers believed that U.S.A.I.D. projects would not have been allowed without the Taliban’s approval, so their support for the Taliban grew, a study found.
abstract: Study evaluating impact of American assistance in Afghanistan finds that Afghan support for Taliban, rather than for United States or Afghan government, increased after United States stabilization projects.
lead_paragraph: Villagers believed that U.S.A.I.D. projects would not have been allowed without the Taliban’s approval, so their support for the Taliban grew, a study found.

headline.main: Afghans See Taliban as a Key to U.S. Aid Projects, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Some Afghans View Taliban as the Key to Aid, Study Finds

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Agency for International Development
